quick-highlight.borderOnly: Highlight only the borderline, not the background color of the text.
quick-highlight.caseInsensitive: Highlight matched words ignoring case sensitivity.
quick-highlight.automaticWordBoundaryHan:
When unchecked, text is highlighted simply based on matches, just like a standard search.

The default setting is **ON**. For example, if you select and highlight the word `moon`, which is surrounded by spaces or other word boundaries, it is automatically treated as an independent word. This means that `moon` inside `moonlight` will **not** be highlighted.

Conversely, if you select and highlight `moon` within `moonlight`, both `moon` and the `moon` inside `moonlight` will be highlighted.
